result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:04 PM Defendant Dylan Michael Lenz appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner appeared by video for Dylan Michael Lenz.  Prosecuting attorney Kurt Frederich Klomberg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim set. Court sets $150,000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with victim, victim's residence, victim's family, victim's school, victim's health care providers & victim's employment. Defendant shall remain at home residence except for school, court hearings, work and all health care appointments.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
